info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 1:17PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 145 PM MDT... At 117 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Raton Crews Airport, or 15 miles southwest of Raton, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raton Crews Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 429 and 440. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 322 and 338. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
